author: Maria
text: I sold an item at VC 11555535 and afterwards understood that I had made a mistake, as I sold a jacket from my sister, thinking it was mine. I checked online on their terms and conditions that I was allowed to cancel the sale by law, as their terms and conditions do not stop me from doing so. Althought this is a very silly mistake, and of course it is my own fault, which I entirely assume, I can request this, so, they would need to process it by law. Nevertheless, when I contacted VC, I was told that technically it was not possible, as the item was already on their warehouse, so technically was not mine. But, in reality, I was not paid and the item had not been shipped to the buyer anyway. How come that they create a system that they cannot fulfil themselves. It was indeed my fault, but if the system allows me to cancel the sale, for sure, they need to allow that to happen. Otherwise, the system is unreliable and I can sue them and seek compensation. It seems that the whole process is very automatic and they have no control over it.
title: I sold an item at VC 11555535 and…

author: Brook
text: I paid extra to have my order checked and authenticated as it could have been sent direct for free. The item passed the checks but when I received it the leather on the straps was rubbed off and the hardwear was scratched. The item was listed as very good and the photographs and description said nothing about the defects. This is against their criteria for very good items which says it must state any defects. I reported this and vestiare offered me free shipping. On a designer bag this is simply not good enough if I wanted this repaired it would cost over £100. Their customer service team is terrible at communicating and they said all they could do was offer me this 'code' for free shipping and let the warehouse know to be more vigilant. I would avoid at all costs and shop elsewhere. This was my first time purchasing from them and I will never use the site again.
title: Avoid

author: Su
text:
I'll leave this review here but have raised the rating from one to three stars. After leaving this review, VC did act in a way I'd hav expected and actually refunded the £20. I also used the free shipping on my next order. I've now made three purchases and all the items have been as described and delivered from France very quickly.

**Avoid** I've been considering a VC purchase for years and finally bought something yesterday. Before checking out I was offered £20 off my first purchase over £150. This misleading offer stated no terms so I assumed all would be fine. I'd spent an hour finding another item (to make up the total to £150). On checking out, the code was accepted but did nothing. The chat bot directed me to continue through the various checkout procedures and my discount would be taken at the end. Instead, this completed my transaction without a 'confirm your order' page, so my money was taken.

On complaining about all this faff and paying more than expected, the chat (real people) were useless; first accusing me of trying to use the code on my second order when in fact I'd never ordered before - then suggesting I must be in another country than the UK (I'm in the UK).

On further complaining by email, it transpires that for the code to work, the purchase price must be for a single item. I've been offered free shipping on my next order. NO THANK YOU! I won't be placing a 'next order'.

-- edit -- 

Further to my previous edit, the sunglasses I purchased have had to be refunded because the seller has said they are no longer for sale. So, I'm left with a handbag I paid £75 which I hadn't planned on buying and should only paid £50 for.
title: customer service not the best, broken app

author: G. J.
text: This is the second (NEGATIVE) review I have written about Vestiaire Colletive. A year ago, I wrote about my first experience on this platform. A bag was advertised, I contacted the seller, I was sent a price-offer and I bought it. After payment was processed, my purchase was confirmed. Shortly afterwards, I received an email claiming that the item was no longer available and my money would be refunded. Pathetic. And dubious. Recently I decided to try a second time. I purchased earrings which the seller would be send directly to me. My Paypal payment went through but no email confirmation arrived from VC. After a week, I contacted Customer Service. I was told that my purchase had gone though. Why didn’t I receive an email about this in the first place? I then wrote back requesting information on when I could expect delivery of my purchase, as the seller had not been in contact, despite me sending her a message via the VC website. Now I have received an email claiming that the purchase will be cancelled because the goods were not delivered within the mandatory 14 days since purchase (still actually have 2 days to go). So my guess is the earrings have long been unavailable for whatever reason or the seller-profile was fake. This company is incapable of running a transparent, honest business. Either the items are suddenly not available after purchase or the seller can’t be contacted and never sends the goods. All of you who have had satisfactory experience with VC, I‘m really happy for you. But I for one will never have anything to do with VC again.
title: Second NEGATIVE experience with VC

author: Katie
text: I've been a member for ages, and unfortunately felt compelled to tell other potential customers not to get their hopes up. Over the last year I've had six (6!) consecutive orders cancelled after the sale went through – a few times after weeks of waiting and hundreds (sometimes 1000s) of $ being transferred. It is refunded of course, but after waiting, expecting for weeks and weeks, and then suddenly the item is 'not available'. There seems to be no accountability or trust system to actually follow through on a sale. No way to leave a review of the seller or contact them, either. After these multiple bad experiences, I wonder how many of these items are actually for sale, or whether there is something else going on. It's like shopping at an imaginary store. Quite a big waste of time, in my opinion better spent on other sites where you actually receive what you bought! :)
title: Muliple cancelled sales; no accountability

author: Daisy Scaramella
text:
Highly disappointed!
Items sent to me were undoubtedly not  the items in the photos/description but they passed anyway the quality check. One pochette Hermes described as red everywhere was actually pink fluo. The seller admitted the mistake and offered me a discount but VC customers service said that the item matched the description so denied the problem. One Chanel pochette described as “new, never worn” has actually a very visible sign of a pen and passed the quality check! Highly NOT RECOMMENDED

These 2 last problems are not the only ones I had with VC. For example, once the sent me very disgustingly ysl shoes and refused to refund me... I therefore stopped for year buying from them, then I thought that things would have been better but I was wrong!
title: Highly disappointed!
